data.title: Paulo Moura played Pixiguinha
data.meta_description:
Dear Forum Members,

Back in february 2002 I enjoyed a performance of the late Brazilian sax/clarinet player Paulo Moura and his band in Amsterdam in...
data.text:
Dear Forum Members,

Back in february 2002 I enjoyed a performance of the late Brazilian sax/clarinet player Paulo Moura and his band in Amsterdam in february 2002.

Paulo Moura a former member of Sergio Mendes Bossa Rio Sextet in the early 1960’s played on this event amongst 3 other unknown musicians with another member of Sergio’s Brasil 77 group, percussionist extraordinaire Laudir Oliviera Soares (later a member of supergroup Chicago). Great Concert...

The concert concept was exclusively work of the Brazilian Choro composer,arranger, flautist and sax player

Alfredo da Rocha Viana Filhos, better known as Pixinguinha.

Virtuoso flautist Pixinguinha played the genres Choro, Samba, Waltz and Brazilian Jazz, his musical style had a great influence on Jobim, Ary Barrosa Dorival Caymmi and countless other Brazilian musicians.

Pixinguinha lived from april 23 1897 till February 7, 1973. He toured Europe in 1922.

His well known composition ‘Carinhoso’ and especially the recording of Cellist Yo-Yo Ma is a

breathtaking high quality peace along with Paquita Rivera on clarinet, Brazilian percussionist Cyro Baptista, and Brazilian Romero Lubambo on acoustic guitar.

All the best,

Aqua do Brasil (AKA Sjef Nix)
